page.title: 06LIFE IN ASTON SOMERVILLE
page.content: Aston Somerville, population about 200, is surrounded by farms but few people work on the land. Most travel to nearby towns their work ranging from managing directors, architects and the self employed. Cars are essential as buses only run to Evesham and Cheltenham on Thursdays and Saturdays. School buses are provided for the children who number about 50 under the age of eighteen. The village has a play group, youth club and small playing field for the children. The church is active in the village. Social and fund raising activities are held in the village hall, also the Womens Institute. The mobile library calls fortnightly. There are darts and bowls teams at the licenced social club. Many families enjoy gardening and grow their own fruit and vegetables.
